headline: Chevron And Exxon Top Earnings But Only One Supermajor Saw Profit Growth; U.S. Oil Prices And Venezuela In Focus
summary: Chevron and Exxon Mobil both reported fourth-quarter earnings and revenue before Friday's stock market open.  Exxon Mobil notched its first quarterly profit increase in more than a year and enters Friday's stock market trading around record highs.  Exxon Mobil reported Friday that Q4 EPS increased 2.4% to $1.71, while revenue declined 1.3% to $82.31 billion.

content.title: Chevron And Exxon Top Earnings But Only One Supermajor Saw Profit Growth; U.S. Oil Prices And Venezuela In Focus

headline: SLB Wins PDO Block-6 Deals Tying Local Manufacturing To Long-Term Services
summary: SLB (NYSE:SLB) secured major five-year contracts from Petroleum Development Oman tied to Block-6, the country's largest oil and gas asset. The agreements include local manufacturing of wellheads and deployment of advanced recovery and artificial lift technologies. The program is expected to support hundreds of Omani jobs and deepen SLB's role in Oman's oil field operations. For you as an investor, this development sits at the core of what SLB does, providing technology and services that...
